meanings.definition: Having a higher osmotic pressure than a particular fluid
meanings.sent1: The hypertonic solution pulled water out of the cell.
meanings.sent2: The hypertonic environment caused the cell to shrink.
meanings.sent3: The hypertonic drink made the plant cells thirsty.
meanings.sent4: Her words had a hypertonic effect on the atmosphere.
meanings.sent5: The hypertonic solution was like a vacuum for the cell's water.

meanings.definition: Characterized by excessive tension or tone
meanings.sent1: His hypertonic muscles were always tense.
meanings.sent2: The hypertonic patient had stiff limbs.
meanings.sent3: The hypertonic cat refused to relax on the couch.
meanings.sent4: The hypertonic atmosphere in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent5: Her hypertonic voice revealed her nervousness to the audience.

meanings.definition: A solution with a higher concentration of solutes than another solution
meanings.sent1: The hypertonic was used to preserve the food.
meanings.sent2: The hypertonic was added to the mixture to increase its concentration.
meanings.sent3: The hypertonic spilled on the table, creating a sticky mess.
meanings.sent4: The hypertonic in the experiment stood out due to its high solute content.
meanings.sent5: The hypertonic solution was crucial for the success of the project.
